data.author: StocksandRocks
data.content: Lots to unpack in that DB interview: - RR 55oz this year (he said 55-60 and 50-55, but settled at 55 - due to low grades and recovery - said it was normal for end of mine - Dec 26) - La India - no production in 2026 (he said 2027, plus trading update had no output for La India in it - this is a step back from previous presentations and a surprise given that La India is supposed to be ahead of schedule - however at least it manages expectations) - CAPEX 90m to go.  May have a cash shortage Q1/Q2 due to tax payments in Philippines. Has 30m facility. - Dupax - on hold for now as not a mining friendly environment, plus company reputation more important (agreed) - Abra - drilling done H1 26 (not mentioned when results would be issued) - RR plant will be dismantled and relocated - where? Will have better idea end H1 - (this has an earnings (EPS) hit due to assets NBV potentially being written-down) La India - 700-800koz from open-cut is baseline - 2 undergrounds identified, plan 1.5m to 1.8mozs 12-15 years, AISC 1150-1200 (not sure if this includes the underground mining, hope so) - working with Nic government - direct line to Mining Minister and therefore President - China influence is there, China building airport (USA will not like that) Looking forward - no longer a junior explorer - only looking at assets that are construction ready (Phil. construction team ready to deploy if assets identified) - March 26 taking 24 analysts to La India to see progress and therefore increase company profile. - No plans for share dilution, however mentioned having treasury shares (300m  of them - these are not counted in any website calculations, eg. P/E, and for me, if used that looks like dilution of my current holding - happy to be corrected) Did I miss anything?

data.author: LiqMyAce
data.content: "Rat poison squared" is a famous, highly critical phrase coined by investor Warren Buffett in 2018 to describe Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies. It signifies that he believes Bitcoin is not just dangerous or useless ("rat poison") but exceptionally so ("squared"), viewing it as a speculative, non-productive bubble that will likely end in disaster. It's a classic pyramid scheme that can only continue if another fool pays more than the last fool for it. Remember BTC is not a physical thing that has utility, it exists as a bunch of electrons on a network of computers. Almost nobody accepts BTC as a currency of trade. If I had some, where could I spend them? Something that can fluctuate +/- as much as 10% or more in a day is not an investment, it's simply a gamble. For those that own it, I wish you luck. Personally I'm with Buffett.

data.author: Antroot
data.content: Talk about drop today. The new fed Kevin warsh apparently hawkish on interest rate and but agrees with trump on cutting interest rate!! In his view AI could raise productivity and not trigger inflation. Whilst AI could raise productivity perhaps in certain sectors. Coding, health diagnosis and autonomous robots. It has to be noted that there will also be creation of new jobs, like prompt technician and quality control AI. Perhaps it might rejig the workers, I don't see how this could raise more income to the gov to pay off us interest repayment. Also, EU seems to have sped up the India trade deal, which is a major good news for Russia, even though EU says they need to exclude Russian crude, whilst russian crude probably will be used for domestic and others exported to EU at a higher price. It also has to be noted Modi and Putin was hugging each other just a month before. And us actually raised tariff on India because of imported crude from Russia. Whilst China gets shafted with human rights stuff, India on the other hand is pretty much oligarchy masquerading as a democracy. Perhaps EU could agree on it. Just my macro view, but geopolitical tension is shifting but unsure of stability.

data.author: AuInspired
data.content: At the time of writing, gold is over $5000/oz, and MTL is forecasting a minimum of 50,000oz at AISC of around $1500/oz for 2026. Within a one-year time frame, we should have La India producing 2-3 times the quantity at around 2/3rd of the cost/oz. In just 6 hours of trading today, over 8 million MTL shares have changed hands for around £1.3m, thereby reducing the share price by 6% and the book value MTL (from around £500m) by £30m. Do the maths. People invest for all sorts of reasons. Some focus on the short term, others take the long view. Some chase capital growth, while others prefer the steady comfort of dividends. Whatever your motivation, it’s worth taking the time to research, reflect, and build a strategy that fits your own goals rather than reacting to noise or emotion. Weekhands and short-termism make for skittish investing.  After all, knee‑jerk reactions tend to be made by people acting like jerks. I'm backing the current management of MTL to make the right calls. Keep your powder dry and buy on the dips.

data.author: Tikitaki
data.content: The interconnecting America-Constancia-Escondido veins have a resource of 288,000 oz at 6.0g/t gold including 120,000 oz at 7.8g/t gold in the Indicated Category. The latter is largely estimated from historic underground channel sampling, which was restricted to the high grade core of the veins that were historically targeted for mining. The resource estimation excludes gold mineralisation in the remnant wallrock of the old mine workings as this area has not been previously drilled. Condor has completed 2,664m of a 4,000m drilling programme through the historic mine works of the America-Constancia-Escondido veins. Several drilling intercepts through the old mine workings, including LIDC179 of 4.65m at 6.11g/t gold demonstrate significant gold mineralisation remains in the remnant wallrock."

data.author: leehardcastle
data.content: The United States officially ended the gold standard in stages, with the final, complete abandonment occurring on August 15, 1971, when President Richard Nixon terminated the direct convertibility of the U.S. dollar to gold. This action, known as the "Nixon Shock," ended the Bretton Woods system, the price of gold was $42 an ounce, the US debt was $0.39 Trillion. Today gold is $5200 and the US owe nearly $39 Trillion, so the debts have grown 100 fold and gold has increased 120 fold, as a store of value, you can’t knock it. We know the US are likely to add $2.5 trillion to the current debt in the next 12 months, another $3 Trillion the year after, and so on, gold will happily track and rise as the debt grows both bigger with ever larger chunks higher each year, Trump has already admitted that’s not an issue for him, and hence the rush to safety, this bull run will last, and those in the banking system know it, hence the central bank buying, the dollar has lost 99% of its purchasing power in just 55 years, that’s a fact, the last percent is now losing its value. Stay with gold, it’s proven itself already.

data.author: kenj
data.content: "the rest are going to be certificated" Lee, Not sure that materialising (converting shares to paper certificates) is a good idea. The Government has been pushing for years to abolish all paper shares. The shares are harder to trade and more expensive to do so in paper form, which could cause a problem if you needed to sell quickly. As you said, your broker will not wish to assist you as you would be taking the shares out of your account with them. Another issue is if your shares are held in an ISA. They would need to come out of the ISA and you would lose their Capital Gains immunity whenever you sell any of them. I would also like to hold my shares in my name, but paper certificates is not the way. It was previously possible to do this by holding your shares in  a personal CREST account. This was considerably more expensive than a broker nominee account, but nobody seems to offer this service any more.

data.title: Exercise of Warrants, Grant of Options, and TVR
data.full_content:
Today 07:00
RNS Number : 4812S
Metals Exploration PLC
11 February 2026
METALS EXPLORATION PLC
Exercise of Warrants, Grant of Options, and Total Voting Rights
Metals Exploration PLC (AIM: MTL) ("Metals Exploration" or the "Company"), a gold producer, development and exploration company with assets in the Philippines and Nicaragua, announces that (1) it has received a notice of warrant exercise in respect of 150,000 new ordinary shares of £0.0001 each ("Ordinary Shares") with an exercise price of £0.0605 each; and (2) the Company has granted options over 12,000,000 Ordinary Shares to two senior executives, in line with its existing Long-Term Incentive Plan ("LTIP") scheme, as detailed below.
Long-Term Incentive Plan Options ("LTIP Options")
At the General Meeting of shareholders held on 23 August 2024, a LTIP was approved, granting the Directors authority to issue up to 15% of the Company's issued capital as LTIP Options. In accordance with this approval the Company has issued a further 12 million options.
The key terms of these LTIP Options are as follows:
·
Exercise price: £0.0001 per Ordinary Share.
·
Exercise period: 7 years from issue.
Vesting conditions
:
·
A minimum consecutive continuing employment of three years with or, as applicable, a service relationship as a non-executive director, consultant, contractor or other adviser to the Company following each performance condition summarised below having been met. The relevant dates are 31 March 2028 regards to the 7,000,000 LTIP Options and 15 January 2029 regards to 5,000,000 LTIP Options; and
·
One-third of the options shall vest upon the earliest date following the grant date upon which the value of an Ordinary Share (based on the volume-weighted average price over a 30-day period) is at least:
7,000,000
(i) 10 pence; (ii) 15 pence; and (iii) 20 pence.
5,000,000
(i) 20 pence; (ii) 25 pence; and (iii) 30 pence.
Admission and Total Voting Rights
Application has been made to the London Stock Exchange PLC for the admission of 150,000 new Ordinary Shares to trading on AIM ("Admission"), which is expected to take place at 8.00 a.m. on or around 12 February 2026.
Following Admission, the Company will have 3,259,247,368 Ordinary Shares in issue, of which 299,385,458 Ordinary Shares are held in treasury, and, accordingly, the total number of voting rights is 2,959,861,910. Therefore, this figure may be used by shareholders in the Company as the denominator for the calculation by which they may determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or change to their interest in, the share capital of the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

data.author: AuInspired
data.content: Today's RNS, covering a new Incentive Plan, looks like the board is looking to keep Darren focused as MTL is forced to change tack. There will be a major upheaval at Runruno with many disappointed workers and loss of a community that has taken years to build. Darren's Philippine family life may also be affected unless he finds something in the country to follow up on other than Abra. There will also be additional costs in closing down Runruno. Whilst it appears Darren is looking at options which take up his and other management time, MTL with La India production only 9 months away, has become a potential opportunity for a cash-rich mid-tier miner. Would you accept 25p with a closing in May?

data.author: leehardcastle
data.content: It may be hard for those who have only been an MTL shareholder for just 13 months, as you haven’t witnessed how Darren took a loss making mine near bankrupt, to a high efficient profit making mine, that’s not only paid off all $137 million debts at a horrible 15% bearing interest rate, then bought out a non compliant major share holder and placed his share in treasury, once debt free we had doom mongers saying we will run out of gold in 2 years and what a miserable outlook we had, then without a single word or hint, Condor was bought and the La India mine is 50% built, again achieved from the efficient and prosperous Runruno incomes, Dupax was the logical first target for continuing Runruno and he had to pursue it, the locals have scuppered it in reality, leaving Darren to pivot, and because gold has risen to new levels, his incomes are big enough to allow him to pivot to a new shovel ready reserve, the offers may have been on the table before, but the $40 plus million quarters being a reality for the rest of the year allow him to make a shovel ready project become reality. The treasury shares that cost him £25 million are also piggy bank savings worth multiples of that investment, and can be put into play to help finance a new shovel ready mine, the hints were made in the Crux video and the drop of Dupax completely for now is another clue, the next Condor style acquisition will be just as out of the blue as Condor, an RNS stating interest will actually be a done deal in the back ground, and as we can see how quick we have built La India, Runruno 2 will follow 18 months later. Other mines based on how the shareprice moves today is not a reason to let this amazing and masterful company slip from your fingers, be patient as the best is coming, and clarity for Runruno is just a few months away.

data.content: Sakura, yes. For 2027 MTL is a great story, and holding on makes a lot of sense, especially if you got in low and have material holdings like many LTHs here. Here's a bit of analysis: SRB - MCap (today)=£254m   -2026 forecast prodn=55k oz  -AISC $1,816 -PoG (Assume) $4,500 USD/GBP Xrate 1.35  Operating CF= £109m MC/oCF  =2.3 MTL -  MCap (today)=£465m   -2026 forecast prodn=55k oz  -AISC $1,525 -PoG (Assume) $4,500 USD/GBP Xrate 1.35  Operating CF= £121m MC/oCF  =3.8 SRB currently makes sense and should have an SP that is much higher than it is today, hence my switch But wait, MTL in future MTL -  MCap (today)=£465m   -2027 forecast prodn (Nov25 pres)=126k oz  -AISC $1,200 -PoG (Assume) $4,500 USD/GBP Xrate 1.35  Operating CF= £308m MC/oCF  =1.5 .... to get back to 3.8 would require a market cap of £1.18bn, then assume 10% dilution (the Treasury shares), so x90% =£1.06bn growth 2.28 vs MC today... that's very nice MTL is a super future story, providing all other risks are managed. The next 3 to 6  months will tell a lot.

data.author: StocksandRocks
data.content: I have got out of MTL in my ISA after the interview and moved into Serabi (SRB). With this move I have minimised all these recent MTL hits and indeed am up 15% since I switched, all SRB movement. I appreciate markets are volatile and all this can reverse. MTL is a good story for 2027, however it is a one mine producer currently, with an uncertain future in Philippines. I have to recognise I made a mistake back in July 2025, when I invested in MTL instead of SRB. The last straw was when the recently the MTL SP went below my July 25 buy price, even with PoG being sky high. SRB had fallen as well and I considered that a better buying opportunity/less risky investment to grow. I still think the story of MTL is generally good, but has soured recently, and there are better choices out there, with less geo political risk. I hope Nic doesn't come into the USA sights with China building an airport there, as La India is the only story in town with MTL at the moment. I am still holding some MTL in my F&S for now, so I may still post on this BB every so often, especially if I step in big time again. :) For all you LTH I wish you every success and hope you realise your plans. GLA

data.author: ElectricLion
data.content: It has been apparent that the Philippines is not the best jurisdiction for mining for some time. A while back, DB did an entire presentation on the reforms he thought were needed. At best, it just takes a long time to get anything done. Nic has it's own issues, but they are far more open to mining investment. Acquiring another project in another jurisdiction would be very useful to manage the risk of having all our eggs in one basket, no matter how good that basket may appear to be. But there are only so many projects like La India globally, and they will all be substantially more expensive than CNR was, now that the gold price has taken off, and pulled the whole sector along with it. Interesting times. I'm holding, but with a little less conviction than before. La India is the golden goose for sure and sentimentally, I've gotta see production happening there, having waited all this time! But I would really like to see some good news elsewhere for a change as well.

data.author: Sunjammer99
data.content: Exercise of Warrants, Grant of Options, and Total Voting Rights Metals Exploration PLC (AIM: MTL) ("Metals Exploration" or the "Company"), a gold producer, development and exploration company with assets in the Philippines and Nicaragua, announces that (1) it has received a notice of warrant exercise in respect of 150,000 new ordinary shares of £0.0001 each ("Ordinary Shares") with an exercise price of £0.0605 each; and (2) the Company has granted options over 12,000,000 Ordinary Shares to two senior executives, in line with its existing Long-Term Incentive Plan ("LTIP") scheme, as detailed below. Long-Term Incentive Plan Options ("LTIP Options") At the General Meeting of shareholders held on 23 August 2024, a LTIP was approved, granting the Directors authority to issue up to 15% of the Company's issued capital as LTIP Options. In accordance with this approval the Company has issued a further 12 million options. The key terms of these LTIP Options are as follows: ·      Exercise price: £0.0001 per Ordinary Share. ·      Exercise period: 7 years from issue. Vesting conditions: ·       A minimum consecutive continuing employment of three years with or, as applicable, a service relationship as a non-executive director, consultant, contractor or other adviser to the Company following each performance condition summarised below having been met. The relevant dates are 31 March 2028 regards to the 7,000,000 LTIP Options and 15 January 2029 regards to 5,000,000 LTIP Options; and ·       One-third of the options shall vest upon the earliest date following the grant date upon which the value of an Ordinary Share (based on the volume-weighted average price over a 30-day period) is at least: 7,000,000 (i) 10 pence; (ii) 15 pence; and (iii) 20 pence. 5,000,000 (i) 20 pence; (ii) 25 pence; and (iii) 30 pence. Admission and Total Voting Rights Application has been made to the London Stock Exchange PLC for the admission of 150,000 new Ordinary Shares to trading on AIM ("Admission"), which is expected to take place at 8.00 a.m. on or around 12 February 2026. Following Admission, the Company will have 3,259,247,368 Ordinary Shares in issue, of which 299,385,458 Ordinary Shares are held in treasury, and, accordingly, the total number of voting rights is 2,959,861,910. Therefore, this figure may be used by shareholders in the Company as the denominator for the calculation by which they may determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or change to their interest in, the share capital of the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

data.author: Slippery1
data.content: In addition, each Condor Gold Shareholder will be entitled to one Contingent Value Right for each Condor Gold Share held (the "CVR Consideration"), which entitles them to their pro rata share of: o  US$14.4 million (to be paid in pounds sterling using the CVR Exchange Rate) following the first gold pour after commissioning of the relevant processing facilities (as confirmed by the Independent CVR Representative) using ore from the La India mining operations, subject to the first gold pour occurring within the five-year period following the earlier of (i) the first date upon which a suitable drilling rig to carry out the agreed work commitments has been mobilised to the La India Project (as confirmed by the Independent CVR Representative); and (ii) six months following the Effective Date (the "CVR Commencement Date"), to be settled by way of the issue of loan notes (issued by MTL) with a maturity of six months and one day after their date of issue (the "Loan Notes"), within 15 Business Days of the first gold pour; and o  up to an aggregate of US$14.4 million on the basis of US$18.00 per ounce (to be paid in pounds sterling using the CVR Exchange Rate) of additional contained gold JORC Mineral Resource discovered in excess of 3.158 million ounces (Moz) total resource at the Condor Group's La India, Rio Luna and Estrella projects (the "Gold Projects") (subject to a cap of 800,000 ounces above the 3.158Moz hurdle), over the five-year period following the CVR Commencement Date. Payments due under the CVR, will be settled by way of the issue of either New MTL Shares or unsecured Loan Notes, or a combination thereof, at MTL's sole election, following the third and fifth anniversary of the CVR Commencement Date. · Accordingly, the maximum potential CVR Consideration payable pursuant to the Offer, as detailed further below, amounts to US$28.8 million (approximately £22.6 million at the Exchange Rate), representing 11.1p per Condor Gold Share (the "Maximum CVR Consideration"). Accordingly, the Fixed Consideration and the Maximum CVR Consideration (at the Exchange Rate), in aggregate, could amount to up to approximately £90.1 million, representing approximately 44.1p per Condor Gold Share (the "Maximum Potential Consideration").

data.author: Slippery1
data.content: In addition, each Condor Gold Shareholder will be entitled to one Contingent Value Right for each Condor Gold Share held (the "CVR Consideration"), which entitles them to their pro rata share of: o  US$14.4 million (to be paid in pounds sterling using the CVR Exchange Rate) following the first gold pour after commissioning of the relevant processing facilities (as confirmed by the Independent CVR Representative) using ore from the La India mining operations, subject to the first gold pour occurring within the five-year period following the earlier of (i) the first date upon which a suitable drilling rig to carry out the agreed work commitments has been mobilised to the La India Project (as confirmed by the Independent CVR Representative); and (ii) six months following the Effective Date (the "CVR Commencement Date"), to be settled by way of the issue of loan notes (issued by MTL) with a maturity of six months and one day after their date of issue (the "Loan Notes"), within 15 Business Days of the first gold pour; and o  up to an aggregate of US$14.4 million on the basis of US$18.00 per ounce (to be paid in pounds sterling using the CVR Exchange Rate) of additional contained gold JORC Mineral Resource discovered in excess of 3.158 million ounces (Moz) total resource at the Condor Group's La India, Rio Luna and Estrella projects (the "Gold Projects") (subject to a cap of 800,000 ounces above the 3.158Moz hurdle), over the five-year period following the CVR Commencement Date. Payments due under the CVR, will be settled by way of the issue of either New MTL Shares or unsecured Loan Notes, or a combination thereof, at MTL's sole election, following the third and fifth anniversary of the CVR Commencement Date. · Accordingly, the maximum potential CVR Consideration payable pursuant to the Offer, as detailed further below, amounts to US$28.8 million (approximately £22.6 million at the Exchange Rate), representing 11.1p per Condor Gold Share (the "Maximum CVR Consideration"). Accordingly, the Fixed Consideration and the Maximum CVR Consideration (at the Exchange Rate), in aggregate, could amount to up to approximately £90.1 million, representing approximately 44.1p per Condor Gold Share (the "Maximum Potential Consideration").

data.author: dictumdedicto
data.content: I'm seeing an awful lot of silver 'experts' expecting silver to reach anywhere between $150 and $500 in 2026. My own guess is that we will probably peak at somewhere in the $140 - $180 area, rather than where Michael Oliver sits: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vw78V5Er3XU At the moment I think (hope) that we will stay in a step consolidation phase for a few weeks (say $80 - $100) before moving into the next level $100 - $125, perhaps associated with a strong COMEX delivery. As for gold, it looks like it's setting up for a slow, steady (and healthy) recovery. I think $5,500 is pretty much baked in, but I don't think a peak of $6,000 is out of the question. Meanwhile MTL's share price is still languishing at 15p - 16p. With the wind of gold and silver in the right direction, and first gold expected in Q4 (I wouldn't be surprised with an August or September announcement), we could see a stellar November\December; perhaps even a 30p share price as we close in on 2027 production.

data.author: Sakura7
data.content: The point is that “trust” is the wrong word. Of course if a ceo is untrustworthy you would not invest in the company. Beyond that the question is one of competence. CEOs will present their companies in favourable terms so you do have to read between the two the lines and consider the context. Chilliboots has observed that we have seen a big change in the approach to Dupax. Initially we are told there will be a rolling release of drill results. Then everything goes quiet although we get a photo of some drill cores. Corporate presentations barely mention Dupax and the drill results never come.  Some talk about monsoon damage and now it’s all about a recalcitrant community who are known to be politically motivated. We never did get the drill results. I am not criticising DB , sometimes you drop things softly. But as investors we should be reading and listening carefully

data.author: accipiter
data.content: I think DB handled the Dupax questions in an honest way,.We have to accept that Dupax in now finished as a project for the foreseeable future.  In updates or these types of interview Darren has never laid all of his cards fully on the table but always keeps some hidden from view, as is best business practice. He hinted two or three times at being open to opportunities further afield in Philippines, South-East Asia and central America.  A telling moment was when said that he in Nic he doesn’t deal with intermediaries but talks directly to the mines minister of Nicaragua, who of course is in daily contact with President Daniel Ortega. All in all today is a good update, with a little uptick in the SP and despite some minor negatives MTL is on track to deliver for us all later this year.

data.author: StocksandRocks
data.content: Lots to unpack in that DB interview: - RR 55oz this year (he said 55-60 and 50-55, but settled at 55 - due to low grades and recovery - said it was normal for end of mine - Dec 26) - La India - no production in 2026 (he said 2027, plus trading update had no output for La India in it - this is a step back from previous presentations and a surprise given that La India is supposed to be ahead of schedule - however at least it manages expectations) - CAPEX 90m to go.  May have a cash shortage Q1/Q2 due to tax payments in Philippines. Has 30m facility. - Dupax - on hold for now as not a mining friendly environment, plus company reputation more important (agreed) - Abra - drilling done H1 26 (not mentioned when results would be issued) - RR plant will be dismantled and relocated - where? Will have better idea end H1 - (this has an earnings (EPS) hit due to assets NBV potentially being written-down) La India - 700-800koz from open-cut is baseline - 2 undergrounds identified, plan 1.5m to 1.8mozs 12-15 years, AISC 1150-1200 (not sure if this includes the underground mining, hope so) - working with Nic government - direct line to Mining Minister and therefore President - China influence is there, China building airport (USA will not like that) Looking forward - no longer a junior explorer - only looking at assets that are construction ready (Phil. construction team ready to deploy if assets identified) - March 26 taking 24 analysts to La India to see progress and therefore increase company profile. - No plans for share dilution, however mentioned having treasury shares (300m  of them - these are not counted in any website calculations, eg. P/E, and for me, if used that looks like dilution of my current holding - happy to be corrected) Did I miss anything?

data.author: LiqMyAce
data.content: "Rat poison squared" is a famous, highly critical phrase coined by investor Warren Buffett in 2018 to describe Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies. It signifies that he believes Bitcoin is not just dangerous or useless ("rat poison") but exceptionally so ("squared"), viewing it as a speculative, non-productive bubble that will likely end in disaster. It's a classic pyramid scheme that can only continue if another fool pays more than the last fool for it. Remember BTC is not a physical thing that has utility, it exists as a bunch of electrons on a network of computers. Almost nobody accepts BTC as a currency of trade. If I had some, where could I spend them? Something that can fluctuate +/- as much as 10% or more in a day is not an investment, it's simply a gamble. For those that own it, I wish you luck. Personally I'm with Buffett.

Just my macro view, but geopolitical tension is shifting but unsure of stability.

data.author: AuInspired
data.content: At the time of writing, gold is over $5000/oz, and MTL is forecasting a minimum of 50,000oz at AISC of around $1500/oz for 2026. Within a one-year time frame, we should have La India producing 2-3 times the quantity at around 2/3rd of the cost/oz. In just 6 hours of trading today, over 8 million MTL shares have changed hands for around £1.3m, thereby reducing the share price by 6% and the book value MTL (from around £500m) by £30m. Do the maths. People invest for all sorts of reasons. Some focus on the short term, others take the long view. Some chase capital growth, while others prefer the steady comfort of dividends. Whatever your motivation, it’s worth taking the time to research, reflect, and build a strategy that fits your own goals rather than reacting to noise or emotion. Weekhands and short-termism make for skittish investing.  After all, knee‑jerk reactions tend to be made by people acting like jerks. I'm backing the current management of MTL to make the right calls. Keep your powder dry and buy on the dips.

data.author: RetiredBanker
data.content: Explorers always carry a much lower valuation than actual producers as they should. When something very tangible happens they often spike in price, frequently going parabolic and then collapsing when the actual production doesn't follow on time. With Runruno in terminal decline we're being valued as a pure explorer. But if Darren does make regular updates this year and continues to re-iterate first pour at La India in Q4 and expected annual production 145k oz then 2027 would have our annual profit at not much less than current market cap. So I'm with Lee on this one, 1p rise on each monthly update and then a bigger re-rating when first pour is announced

data.author: SurreyNot123
data.content: Thr idea of having to locate the resources at Dupax doesn't sit well with me. I've been waiting fir many MANY years for La India to get up and running / realise some fair value - if the proposition for value add here was dupax I would be out as well. That being said, Dupax wasn't even on the table several months ago, and with progress at la india moving i was content. I'm growing impatient watching other producers steam ahead with the accelerating gold price. Condor Luck wpuld have it that it'll fall back on it's haunches right in time for our first pour and the selloff will be over egged, simply because we're that type of share! The reality is that the maths is just absolutely unreal. I hate the idea of wishing away time - life's short - but I'd really.love for us to be at the point of pouring and making a killing right now. I feel like until the goods receipts are in, the market won't recognise how profitable this company is. If something happens in the Philippines in the mean time then fine. But as many of you have pointed out - a lot of pain for little upside at this point. Metals is lucky to have another jurisdiction to fall back on and one that'll appreciate the jobs, infrastructure and tax revenue from our pan-handling. If Philippines doesn't want it for legitimate socioeconomic reasons, that's their call. An economic loss for sure, but their call all the same. Might just go back to bed for a year!

data.author: TrueRed
data.content: Hi Lee, the rise from 6p to 10-12p with La India announcement was expected and welcomed. But after the June Investor presentation the sp also increased from ca 11p to 16p. However, a spate of bad news from end of September 25 slowed down the momentum and we did drift between 12p and 14p. This is what I meant. When the momentum fades due to lack of progress/news, we get traded like a penny share. However, 30P by La India first pour would also be good enough for me although I may have to delay my retirement benefits. As always, thanks for the encouragement.

data.author: Tikitaki
data.content: The interconnecting America-Constancia-Escondido veins have a resource of 288,000 oz at 6.0g/t gold including 120,000 oz at 7.8g/t gold in the Indicated Category. The latter is largely estimated from historic underground channel sampling, which was restricted to the high grade core of the veins that were historically targeted for mining. The resource estimation excludes gold mineralisation in the remnant wallrock of the old mine workings as this area has not been previously drilled. Condor has completed 2,664m of a 4,000m drilling programme through the historic mine works of the America-Constancia-Escondido veins. Several drilling intercepts through the old mine workings, including LIDC179 of 4.65m at 6.11g/t gold demonstrate significant gold mineralisation remains in the remnant wallrock."

data.author: Major4legs
data.content: Interestingly the gold price move appears to be driven not by central banks now but by ETFs and possibly Stable coins like Tether. Although there is no transparency on Chinese state buying.     Quote from World Gold Council “The highlight is definitely investment demand. The lowlight — the one people may be surprised about — is that central bank demand dropped,” said John Reade, market strategist at the WGC. “The drop in central bank demand was completely overshadowed by the increase we have seen in investment demand.”

data.author: copter
data.content: La India High-Grade Surface Mineralization: The project, which covers 98% of the historic La India Gold Mining District, has demonstrated significant, high-grade surface mineralisation in several veins. Previous results included, for example, 14.05 meters at 6.1 g/t gold in shallow, near-surface, or trenching contexts.

data.author: Tikitaki
data.content: Now I’m back with my clever theories... If I remember correctly, the grades in Runruno are around 1.4 g/t. They probably aren’t necessarily higher in Dupax and, above all, are very deep in the ground. In Nicaragua, we have grades of up to 7 g/t near the surface. I’m going off memory here and don’t feel like or have time to check it exactly. The issue with the environmentalists in Dupax seems to be bigger than expected, and the processes in the Philippines seem very complicated and arbitrary... So again: finish Runruno, prepare everything in Nicaragua in the meantime, and then start with the move.

data.author: Smoothbrain
data.content: I think we are all too quick to dismiss Dupax and DB with MTL and the work they have done so far. It is an area of proven reserves historically and high grade ore, so we know there is gold, just need to locate exactly where. This is supported by the geological data of the area as well as their physics studies People have been interfering with the project, which has caused delays. Delays which DB's pace of getting things done ahead of schedule is probably still going to fall in line with the normal timeline. The interview will be great to answer other questions, but having kept the faith from the 1p range, we are in such better ground compared to before. Even the BIOX contamination has ended up generating income as the delay in processing has meant the price of gold increased 25% in the interim. The only question I have left is whether Sakura's title is Duchess or Baroness after reading her comments of her life

data.author: CarefreeCarry
data.content: The thing with Darren is that he will have a plan B as well as C, D and E. Condor came out of nowhere for the MTL shareholders just over a year ago. A stroke of genius. The guy lives and breathes mining. Thanks to his stewardship of MTL he helped my SIPP break through £1m last year. When we reached 15.5p my 6.5m MTL shares were £1m on their own. Thanks to PoG my other mining stocks have helped drive my SIPP through £2m. It's taken 35 years to get here for me from when I was 21. The potential here and with other mining companies is massive at the moment, relax and just enjoy the ride. I certainly am, along with quite a few other shareholders who post here I suspect.

data.author: citizenblue
data.content: Please read again:- ‘Exploration - Dupax, Philippines · Drill programme continuing - limited drilling conducted during the Quarter with no near term production opportunity discovered to date’. WHICH MEANS, STILL MORE DRILLING TO DO @ DUPAX..!!! DB says the following:- “Drilling at Dupax to date has indicated that the target ore zone is deeper than predicted. As a result, we have concluded that an economic resource at Dupax will not be able to be defined in time for Runruno's ore processing operations to be extended via the processing of Dupax ore. Accordingly, we are considering other options to repurpose the Runruno plant and will keep shareholders updated with any developments”. WHICH MEANS, DUE TO DELAYS, DUPAX WILL NOT BE READY IN TIME TO FEED ORE INTO  RUNRUNO MILL. THEREFORE DB IS LOOKING AT OTHER OPTIONS FOR RUNRUNO MILL IN THE INTERIM PERIOD.

data.author: leehardcastle
data.content: The United States officially ended the gold standard in stages, with the final, complete abandonment occurring on August 15, 1971, when President Richard Nixon terminated the direct convertibility of the U.S. dollar to gold. This action, known as the "Nixon Shock," ended the Bretton Woods system, the price of gold was $42 an ounce, the US debt was $0.39 Trillion. Today gold is $5200 and the US owe nearly $39 Trillion, so the debts have grown 100 fold and gold has increased 120 fold, as a store of value, you can’t knock it. We know the US are likely to add $2.5 trillion to the current debt in the next 12 months, another $3 Trillion the year after, and so on, gold will happily track and rise as the debt grows both bigger with ever larger chunks higher each year, Trump has already admitted that’s not an issue for him, and hence the rush to safety, this bull run will last, and those in the banking system know it, hence the central bank buying, the dollar has lost 99% of its purchasing power in just 55 years, that’s a fact, the last percent is now losing its value. Stay with gold, it’s proven itself already.

data.author: leehardcastle
data.content: Thanks for the reply Ken, it’s not hard to materialise shares (share certs to trading platform) as the brokers want your business, HL do it for free, they just don’t offer it the other way, for obvious reasons as they can’t make money from you if you leave, the share cert is a legal document that shows your share holding of the company, I don’t plan on selling MTL in the next 5 years, I feel the share certificate as safer than having them in a broker, HL have assured me the shares are in my name and that the funds are held safely, but I still worry if the banks go bust, and the funds are in that bank, it would be difficult getting those funds back. My worry started when IG removed all trading fees, now they have removed annual fees, and also pay interest on any balance not invested, so how do they make money? They sound more like a bank than a broker, as in my funds are not actually in their hands, and being used elsewhere making a higher interest for them, I moved to HL because they charge for trades, and now have annual fees, sounds more like a broker which I like, when something is free, like IG I get suspicious. Thoughts welcome.

data.author: Major4legs
data.content: I will put my tin hat on here and just remind everyone that it’s not “nailed on” that gold will continue to rise indefinitely. Granted there is no end in sight for this bull run but if you are building a mine what is a reasonable POG to use to assess if it is economic? If you did this at the end of the last bull run in 1980 and assumed an ever increasing POG you would have lost your shirt. We are in unprecedented times but not sure MTL should be chasing resources at marginal rates requiring a POG over $4k. Cool heads required. Dupax should be a reminder to us all that the future is rarely as good as we hope or as bad as we fear!

data.author: kenj
data.content: "the rest are going to be certificated" Lee, Not sure that materialising (converting shares to paper certificates) is a good idea. The Government has been pushing for years to abolish all paper shares. The shares are harder to trade and more expensive to do so in paper form, which could cause a problem if you needed to sell quickly. As you said, your broker will not wish to assist you as you would be taking the shares out of your account with them. Another issue is if your shares are held in an ISA. They would need to come out of the ISA and you would lose their Capital Gains immunity whenever you sell any of them. I would also like to hold my shares in my name, but paper certificates is not the way. It was previously possible to do this by holding your shares in  a personal CREST account. This was considerably more expensive than a broker nominee account, but nobody seems to offer this service any more.

data.author: Simms45
data.content: So digging more into Mallibeg South is incredibly interesting so why no mention from Metals since 2019? independent JORC-compliant resource update prepared by Mining Associates Pty Ltd for FCF/Metals Exploration, dated March 2013. Geometry: a series of stacked, shallow-dipping mineralised lenses over ~550 m strike, with 2–20 m combined intercept thicknesses; it’s described as being open to the south with potential to add resources. Contained Au: ~340,000 oz (0.34 Moz) If Malilibeg South were mined similar to Run runo Recoverable ounces after mining recovery: 289,000 oz × 0.91 ≈ 263,000 oz Correct me if i am wrong but that is 4-5 years of production? Something must be wrong with the report as this is JORC compliant? Did we sell it or does someone else have it?

Are we missing something but surely Darren is gonna pull this rabbit out of the bag on monday as that gives us plenty of resource for another year+ Who knows but i hope they are drilling around that resource and he drops something as seems almost too good to be true, just perhaps he had bigger fish to fry.

data.author: Mr.Smith
data.content: Simms. FCF minerals published a Resource Estimate for Malilibeg South back in 2013.  Giving a resource of 7.5Mt @ 1.4gr/t Au.  340k oz Au. Interesting to see if Darren gives it a mention in the forthcoming Crux interview.  "The entire Malilibeg South Resource is classified as Inferred; there is sufficient geological and sampling data to imply the geological model is robust with implied grade continuity. Assumptions for reasonable prospects for eventual economic extraction applied to this deposit include but may not be limited to the following:  Gold pricing used of US$1200 troy ounce;  Assumed site operational cash costs (all up, including mining, process, admin and support) of about US$16.17 per tonne."
